##**FLV Creme de Menthe**##

*Summary*  
/u/Vurve said it best when he mentioned that this is a very close representation of a Thin Mint Girl Scout Cookie. The menthol note is very smooth here and not overpowering in anyway. I get a slight hint of chocolate from it, but it's very mellow. The texture is slightly crisp and full. The mint is not super forward, and the chocolatey-creaminess of this makes me feel it would work well in a base or toward the middle range of a receipe. Overall this flavoring is very nice, and works well by itself. I haven't tried it in many mixes, but I immediately find myself wanting to accent that chocolate note a bit more.

**On the Nose**  
Smooth menthol, mellow cream with a hint of cocoa. Dark amber color.

**Recommended Usage**  
*Stand alone*: 3%

*In a mix*: 0.5%-2.5%. 

**Throat**  
Mild

**Ideal Pairings**  
Chocolate, creams, fruits, probably would work well in coffee and tobacco

**Steep**  
Good right away, but it comes together nicely after 3-5 days.

**Recipe Idea: [Thin Mint](https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/8207)**  
*Ratio: 15PG/85VG*  
*Steep: 3 days* 

**Ingredient**|**%**|
:--|:--|
FLV Creme de Menthe|1.75%|
HS Australian Chocolate|0.5%|

FLV Creme de Menthe is the star here, it is really quite good on its own, but I felt to capture the essence of a Thin Mint it needed just a touch more of that chocolate, preferrably a darker chocolate that's slightly crisp, hence the HS Australian Chocolate.  

*Please if your opinion differs, or you have another review for this post it in the comments. Will help the master list with multiple reviews in one spot.*
